intro: Engelhardia zambalensis, commonly known as the Zambal engelhardia, is a rare and endemic tree species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland to montane forest habitats, where it thrives in humid and shaded conditions. Its botanical features include thick, leathery leaves and a distinctive, aromatic bark. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
